result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. River D Weidler

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Not possess or consume any alcohol. No going into any bars, taverns or liquor stores.
Not possess or consume any alcohol. No going into any bars, taverns or liquor stores.

1:16 PM Defendant River D Weidler appeared by video in custody from DCJ.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea Amidon Nodolf in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lanie Krause appears by Zoom on behalf of defendant. B. Bahr - Clerk 
22CM320, 21CF292
State filed bond modification request in 21CF292. Asks for bond to be modified from $1,000 signature bond to a $500 cash bond. 
22CM320 requesting $500 cash bond. Not to consume or possess alcohol.

21CF292 orders bond be modified from $1,000 sign bond to a $250 cash bond. Not possess or consume any alcohol. No going into any bars, taverns or liquor stores.
22CM320 orders $500 sign bond. Not possess or consume any alcohol. No going into any bars, taverns or liquor stores.

22CM320 INIT
Atty Krause - rcvd complaint, waive reading and speedy trial. Enters NG Plea
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on November 8, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
